original_solution_mapping.L1: She needs 60 inches of rope because 10 x 6 equals <<10*6=60>>60
original_solution_mapping.L2: The six-foot length of rope is 72 inches long because 6 x 12 = <<6*12=72>>72
original_solution_mapping.L3: The six-foot length of rope would give her 12 pieces because 72 / 6 = <<72/6=12>>12
original_solution_mapping.L4: The six-foot length is long enough because 12 > 10
original_solution_mapping.L6: She would need 5 of the 1-foot ropes because 60 / 12 = <<60/12=5>>5
original_solution_mapping.L7: If she bought one-foot ropes it would cost $6.25 because 5 x 1.25 = 6.25
original_solution_mapping.L8: The cheapest rope to buy is the 6-foot rope because 5 < 6.25

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6275.
    Returns: the least amount Tanesha has to spend to get the rope she needs.
    """
    # L1
    num_pieces = 10 # 10 pieces
    length_per_piece_inches = 6 # six inches long
    total_rope_needed_inches = num_pieces * length_per_piece_inches

    # L2
    six_foot_rope_length_feet = 6 # 6-foot length of rope
    inches_per_foot = 12 # WK
    six_foot_rope_length_inches = six_foot_rope_length_feet * inches_per_foot

    # L3
    pieces_from_six_foot_rope = six_foot_rope_length_inches / length_per_piece_inches

    # L6
    num_one_foot_ropes_needed = total_rope_needed_inches / inches_per_foot

    # L7
    cost_one_foot_rope = 1.25 # 1-foot lengths of rope that cost $1.25 each
    cost_one_foot_ropes_total = num_one_foot_ropes_needed * cost_one_foot_rope

    # L8
    cost_six_foot_rope = 5 # a 6-foot length of rope that cost $5
    least_cost = cost_six_foot_rope

    # FA
    answer = least_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She needs {total_rope_needed_inches} inches of rope because {num_pieces} x {length_per_piece_inches} equals <<{num_pieces}*{length_per_piece_inches}={total_rope_needed_inches}>>{total_rope_needed_inches}

The six-foot length of rope is {six_foot_rope_length_inches} inches long because {six_foot_rope_length_feet} x {inches_per_foot} = <<{six_foot_rope_length_feet}*{inches_per_foot}={six_foot_rope_length_inches}>>{six_foot_rope_length_inches}

The six-foot length of rope would give her {pieces_from_six_foot_rope} pieces because {six_foot_rope_length_inches} / {length_per_piece_inches} = <<{six_foot_rope_length_inches}/{length_per_piece_inches}={pieces_from_six_foot_rope}>>{pieces_from_six_foot_rope}

She would need {num_one_foot_ropes_needed} of the 1-foot ropes because {total_rope_needed_inches} / {inches_per_foot} = <<{total_rope_needed_inches}/{inches_per_foot}={num_one_foot_ropes_needed}>>{num_one_foot_ropes_needed}
If she bought one-foot ropes it would cost ${cost_one_foot_ropes_total} because {num_one_foot_ropes_needed} x {cost_one_foot_rope} = {cost_one_foot_ropes_total}
The cheapest rope to buy is the 6-foot rope because {cost_six_foot_rope} < {cost_one_foot_ropes_total}

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'six_foot_rope_length_inches' (72) was used instead of 'cost_six_foot_rope' (5).
